turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Future of the British Army (Army 2020 Refine).
turn.1: What does Army 2020 Refine mean for Army Air and Missile Defence?
turn.2: 12th and 16th Royal Artillery will continue to be placed under a joint Army-RAF unit, Joint Ground-Based Air Defence Command.
turn.3: What are some of the changes?
turn.4: Four of the British Army's 36 regular infantry battalions will be disbanded or merged with sister units in their regiments: A fifth battalion, the Argyll and Sutherland Highlanders, 5th Battalion Royal Regiment of Scotland, will be reduced to a single company to carry out public duties in Scotland.
turn.6: However, through the 2020 reforms, 3 new battalions of infantry (1 regular, 2 reserve) have been created including: The Joint Helicopter Command will remain an integral part of the land force.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: The Army Air Corps will be reduced by one regular regiment.
turn.9: Is there a reason for this?
turn.10: 1 and 9 Regt AAC will merge with the new Wildcat helicopter not before Oct 2015.
turn.11: What will be the outcome of this?
turn.12: One Regiment will be at high readiness annually, with one Apache Squadron committed towards the Lead Armoured Battlegroup.
